inn1.comm: Lee slants the ball across the left-hander from over the wicket and bends it back in a little, the batsman defends
Tamim plays the good length ball with a straight bat towards mid-on
length ball with width outside off, Tamim gets going with a firm punch off the front foot through extra cover

that's beaten both batsman and wicketkeeper. Lee sprays it wide outside off, Kayes' eyes light up at the width on offer and he goes after it with a mighty swing, the ball swings away and beats the bat, it swings away from Haddin and beats him too
defended on the off side
length ball outside off stump, Kayes strides forward and punches towards mid-off
that one didn't carry, Tamim let it go outside off and the ball bounced a second time before reaching Haddin, who hasn't had the easiest of starts today
good length outside off stump, Tamim moves forward and defends with a straight bat towards the off side
shorter length with lots of width outside off, Tamim stands in his crease, arches back a touch and drives the ball in front of point through the gap in the in-field. The timing is superb

stunningly caught at first slip! The ball was pretty ordinary, on a length wide outside off, Tamim went after it, driving with power. He didn't make proper contact though and the thick outside edge flew at furious pace towards the left of Watson's head at first slip. Watson moved quickly, taking the catch with both hands. Made it look much simpler than it was.
he strides forward and opens the face to guide the ball to third man
a bit too straight and Kayes uses the angle into him to work the ball off his pads behind square

huge appeal that carried on for ages! And with good reason. Lee banged in the bouncer and it is supremely directed. Kayes fended at it at first but then tried to pull his bat out of the way. He was late in doing so and he definitely gloved it to Haddin. The umpire didn't see it.
Kayes has a wild thrash at a delivery outside off and misses
short of a length outside off, Kayes stays in his crease and lets it go
good length but a touch wide outside off, Kayes moves forward and drives to cover
that's an excellent delivery, pitches on a good length in line with off and deviates slightly to beat the forward prod of the batsman. Played down the wrong line.
flicked off the pads to the fielder at square leg
a touch too full from Johnson and Nafees gets on to the front foot and drives the ball past the fielder at cover. It's four once it gets through the infield
played off the back foot to third man
Johnson tries the yorker but doesn't get the line quite right, Kayes gets hit on the pad after missing the flick
short of a length and straight, Kayes gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
short ball and very straight, Kayes takes one hand off the bat as he defends from his crease
good length on off stump, Kayes gets behind the line on the front foot and blocks
full and wide outside off and Nafees slashes hard at the ball, slicing it in the air towards third man where it bounces a few metres short of the fielder
slower ball on off stump but Kayes spotted it, moving forward and driving crisply towards mid-off
good length outside off and quicker, pushed off the front foot to the man at short cover
short of a length delivery, Kayes stands tall on the back foot and plays it down on the pitch
fuller ball from round the wicket, angling into the left-hander, Kayes drives towards cover
length delivery outside off stump, Kayes moves forward and drives on the up to mid-off. Lee's conceded just one run in his last two overs.
short of a length angling across the left-hander, he has a swish and misses
Nafees has another go at a delivery that slants across him, gets beaten by the slightly higher bounce
this time he moves across his crease, covers his off stump, and lets the ball go through to Haddin
another delivery angling across the left-hander from over the wicket, another delivery left alone
Nafees strides forward and opens the face to guide the ball towards third man
good length outside off stump, Kayes strides forward and defends towards the fielder at short cover
Lee bowls another well-directed bouncer that catches Nafees on the crease, the batsman fends and the ball hits glove and lobs safely on the pitch
short of a length delivery on leg and middle, Nafees tucks the ball behind square
good length and the line is just outside off stump, Kayes moves back and lifts his bat out of the way
another short ball just outside off, Kayes drops his wrists and lets it pass. We haven't seen a hook or pull today. Plenty of short balls on offer.
fuller ball outside off, driven into the ground towards the man at short cover
driven off the front foot towards Hussey at short cover once again. Kayes is now 1 off 24 balls. He has to make this count now.
defended off the back foot towards point, Hastings hits the pitch hard and bowls a heavy sort of ball
straighter line on middle stump, Nafees dabs the ball towards midwicket and calls for a quick single
good length and straight, defended on the front foot
another dot ball from Kayes, defended on the front foot towards Hastings. He's got to look to rotate strike at least.
Kayes has width outside off and he makes good contact with the cut, he doesn't beat point though. He will be feeling this mounting pressure.
Kayes keeps strike by opening the face as he drives to steer the ball to third man
good length and very straight, defended back to the bowler
defended on the front foot towards the off, Lee has a polite chat with the batsman, probably asking him to get it off the square
Lee fires in a bouncer, Kayes ducks under it
Kayes jumps towards leg and tries to flay a full ball from round the wicket through the off side, Kayes misses
Lee doesn't give Kayes any width by angling it in from round the wicket on a good length, Kayes defends on the front foot
shouts of catch it as Kayes drives a length ball on the up towards mid-off, it falls a few feet in front of the fielder. Kayes plays out another maiden
Nafees nudges the ball through square for a single, will he have to watch the rest of the over from the non-striker's end?

well done Kayes! He drops the ball with soft hands on the off side and looks at Nafees, who's charging down for the single. Hastings tried to get to the ball and got in the way of the non-striker. Hussey from cover would have run out Nafees had he hit
beaten outside the off stump
played on the leg side
a slower ball and Nafees plays the ball through square leg
Kayes keeps strike by guiding a wide ball towards third man.
short of a length outside off, Kayes stands tall on the back foot and drives through cover

terrific effort on the third man boundary. Nafees slashes a short and wide ball towards third man where Hastings runs to his left and dives to intercept the racing ball. Ponting runs from point to give Hastings a pat
played to cover on the front foot
Kayes moves forward and defends a good length ball on the leg side
another good length delivery on off and middle, Kayes gets behind it and blocks, like he's done most of today

and his misery is over and this sets Bangladesh back. It was a short ball and Kayes attempted the first pull of the day. He tried to hit it from way way outside off though. It didn't come off and the top-edge flew high in the air towards the leg side where Watson took a simple catch. Bangladesh needed Kayes to kick on and anchor the innings after his excruciatingly slow start. He's gone now, after playing a rash shot. A new batsman will have to come in and get set all over again.
played off the pads through square leg
left alone outside off stump
short ball and Hasan sways slightly and lets it go through to Haddin

bowled him. Bangladesh continue to sink. Hastings hits the pitch short of a length and seams the ball away from the right-hander after pitching around off and middle. Raqibul tries to defend but plays down the wrong line. The ball clips the top of off stump.
defended on the off side off the back foot
full ball outside off and Shakib moves forward and plays a fluent drive through cover, he's batting too low in this line-up
there's no slip! Nafees pushes forward at a delivery that angles into him and he edges it through the vacant cordon. He wanted to play to third man but ended up edging it much finer than intended
Nafees moves forward and across and closes the face of the bat to play on the leg side
Nafees takes one hand off the bat and plays towards point
tries to drive but ends up mis-timing it on the leg side
well-directed short ball and Nafees does well to drop his wrists and sway out of the way
short and wide outside off, Nafees tries to cut without moving feet and gets beaten
angles a short of a length delivery into the left-hander, Shakib plays it from the crease on the leg side
Watson keeps a good length around off, Shakib stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
fuller length outside off, Shakib stays on the back foot and drives to mid-off
Watson's taking lots of pace off the ball, driven off the front foot to mid-off
pushed in front of point for a single
moves forward and pushes a length ball through cover point for one more
short and wide outside off, Nafees goes after it, cutting it in the air over point, finding the gap between third man and the fielder on the sweeper boundary
driven off the front foot towards extra cover
fuller length and straight, Shakib drives towards the bowler
short of a length on off stump, Shakib defends on the back foot
a full ball nearly in the blockhole, Shakib digs it out towards point
good length on off and middle, Shakib defends from the crease towards the leg side
Nafees moves forward and towards the line of the ball outside off before opening the face to steer to third man
he leans forward towards the off this time and defends on the leg side, Watson went wide of the crease to angle the ball into the left-hander
defended confidently towards the off side on the front foot
defended on the front foot towards cover once again
defended on the off side, tight over so far
Nafees ends the over by pushing the ball off his pads towards leg
full ball just outside off, driven towards mid-off
short of a length delivery outside off from round the wicket, Shakib hits it off the back foot through cover
Lee angles a full ball into the left-hander, Nafees moves forward and plays towards midwicket
good length ball that cramps the left-hander for room with the angle from round the wicket, defended on the off side

short of a length and wide outside off, Nafees mis-times the drive away from his body and just as well for him for it fell short of the fielder at deep cover. It might have gone straight to hand had he hit it better
defended from the crease towards the off side
good length ball outside off, driven off the front foot through cover
Watson angles the ball into off and middle from wide of the crease, Shakib plays the ball to midwicket
Shakib punches off the front foot but can't beat the fielder at short cover
short of a length slightly wider outside off, Shakib cuts but hits it into the ground towards point
that's not short enough to pull but the growing pressure makes Shakib attempt it anyway, he makes decent contact but the shot is intercepted by the fielder at midwicket
played back to the bowler this time
Lee pitches short, angling the ball across the left-hander from over the wicket, Nafees stands tall and tries to cut but bottom edges it into the ground near his feet
another short ball which is straighter, Nafees tries to turn it on the leg side but gets a leading edge that drops safely in front of him
that's cut and cut superbly. Not that wide outside off and Nafees cracks it past point and too wide of the fielder at third man. Bangladesh finally go past 50.
played off the pads through midwicket
short ball and Shakib pulls the ball through square, a soft pull though, rolled his wrists and kept it down
glanced off the pads towards fine leg, Lee's line was a bit too straight
a slow Watson delivery beats Nafees and hits him on the pad, Watson begins to appeal but that was missing leg as it was delivered from very wide of the crease
steered with an open face towards third man
that's short on leg stump, Shakib swivels and pulls towards Lee on the fine-leg boundary
another short ball into the body, played down on the leg side
full ball on the pads, Nafees lifts it over the fielder at midwicket and places it well enough to beat the man on the boundary. He didn't try to hit it too hard, just chipped it and placed it well
played off the pads once again behind square
driven off the front foot to the man on the long-off boundary
tossed up wide outside off stump, slapped off the front foot to long off once again
driven firmly off the front foot but Smith leaps to his left and cuts it off
pushed off the front foot towards point

bowled him! Smith flights the ball across the left-hander, drawing Shakib into the front-foot drive, the ball pitches and spins back into the batsman, finding the gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps
Rahim makes a bit of room and drives inside out through cover
he pitches around off and spins the ball past the outside edge of Rahim's push from the crease
Rahim cuts off the back foot to point
he drives, off the front foot third time to cover
fuller ball and Mushfiqur finds the gap with the cover drive
played off the pads towards square leg
over the wicket to the left-hander, Nafees plays off his pads once again
a bit too short and Mushfiqur is quick to go on the back foot and cut through the gap between backward point and short third man
played off the front foot towards point
flighted delivery on middle stump, Mushfiqur makes a bit of room and drives fluently through wide mid-off
driven back to the bowler and Smith dives to his left to field
Nafees strides forward and defends
that's a long hop which keeps rather low, Nafees goes back and pulls along the ground through midwicket
driven off the front foot towards mid-off
a bit too close to off stump to cut but Nafees manages to get it away to deep point
tossed up outside off, pushed on the off side off the front foot
defended with a straight bat towards the bowler
a bit of width outside off and Mushfiqur drives through cover point
Doherty spins the ball into the pads and Nafees work the ball towards fine leg
a full toss outside off, driven through cover. Smith is getting inconsistent with his length after a good first over.
swept on one knee to the man at deep square
better line and length, Nafees drives to the bowler
bowled slowly just outside off stump, Nafees stays in his crease and punches to cover
defended towards the bowler
that's a long hop and Nafees swats it along the ground towards deep square leg
driven to mid off
played off the pads towards square
Nafees moves forward and plays towards point
tossed up outside off stump, Nafees moves forward, gets to the pitch of the ball and gets to fifty with a fabulous cover drive
cut deftly off the back foot just wide of short third man
Mushfiqur paddles the ball from off towards fine leg for a single
Rahim moves forward and plays a punchy inside-out drive to short cover
swept this time, towards deep square leg for one
defended on the front foot towards the off side
a touch too short and a bit too wide outside off, Nafees goes back and cuts, he's given the man on the sweeper boundary lots of work, Hastings runs to his right and makes the stop in the nick of time
tossed up outside off stump, Nafees gets sucked into playing the booming drive through the off side and gets an inside edge past his stumps

that's a soft and silly shot from Nafees and it's undone the only bit of good cricket Bangladesh has played today. Smith flighted the ball and drew Nafees into the drive again. He ended up chipping it straight back to the bowler. One of the easier caught and bowled chances that was.
driven to mid-off off the front foot
Rahim charges and drives to mid-off once again
pushed off the front foot towards cover point
Mushfiqur what are you doing? He steps out to the left-armer and tries to slog the ball over the leg-side against the turn. He ends up hitting it into the ground near his leg
pushed to cover point for a single, Ponting concedes at overthrow after hitting the stumps direct at the batsman's end
defended on the off side
driven towards Smith's left but the bowler dives superbly to cut off the single
defended on the off side on the front foot
tossed up on middle stump, pushed off the front foot towards cover
Mushfiqur gets down low on one knee and sweeps to deep square leg
this time he paddles the ball from outside off towards square leg
Mahmudullah dabs the ball from outside off towards backward point
Mushfiqur plays the ball with the turn away from him towards point
Mushfiqur misses the glance but runs a leg bye towards square leg after the ball hits the pad
Mahmudullah strides forward and blocks
bowled slower outside off, defended on the front foot
lovely ball, drifts into the right-hander and turns away, Mahmudullah pushes forward and gets an edge that runs towards third man
driven off the front foot towards long off. Bangladesh have huffed and puffed to 100
worked off the pads behind square leg for a single
tossed up on middle and off, Mushfiqur moves forward and defends towards point
Mushfiqur steps out and then defends towards the off
swept and Mushfiqur has made crisp contact, placing the ball in the gap on the deep square leg boundary. He rolled his wrists and hit it along the ground
steps out of his crease and drives past the bowler towards long off
pushed back to the bowler this time
pushed off the front foot towards cover for a quick single
tossed up from round the wicket and this one goes straight through, defended on the front foot
Mahmudullah uses the short length to cut the ball deftly through the gap between backward point and third man
played on the leg side off the front foot
driven off the front foot towards extra cover where the fielder cuts it off
Mahmudullah moves forward and drives the ball towards long off
Mahmudullah tries to work the ball against the turn on the leg side but makes poor contact
makes room this time to drive inside out through extra cover
that's too short and Mushfiqur gets back in a flash to pull the ball through wide mid-on, Lee's on the boundary but even he can't cut it off
defended on the off side on the front foot

that's too full and too straight to cut, Mushfiqur gets beaten and the ball crashes into his back pad on the knee roll, loud shout for lbw is turned down, close call, it's given runs as the ball goes towards point.
that's far too wide outside off
punched off the back foot through cover for a single
Mahmudullah brings out the paddle and plays it towards fine leg

and Mahmudullah plays the reverse paddle, placing the ball very fine towards the third-man boundary. Smith chases from short fine leg and dives desperately just as the ball is about to touch the rope. He's pulled off a spectacular save.
worked off the pads towards short fine leg
cut off the back foot towards point
played off the pads towards square leg
Mushfiqur defends on the front foot
that's spectacularly wide outside off stump
that's not spectacularly wide down leg side, but still wide enough
this time it's short of a length and straight, worked off the body towards midwicket
steered towards third man for a single
Johnson bowls a bouncer and the batsman ducks under it
played off the front foot towards point
full ball outside off stump, Mahmudullah leans into a fluent cover drive and times it well, Hussey sprints to his right and slides on the boundary to make the save
good length and straight, defended on the leg side
Mushfiqur gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball from outside off behind square leg
Mahmudullah cuts the ball off the back foot through point
Mushfiqur cuts this time but can't beat the man at point
too full and too close to off to cut, Mushfiqur plays it to point
he was in position to play the paddle sweep very early, and hit it towards fine leg
bowled flat on middle stump, driven past the bowler towards mid-on
short of a length angling into the right-hander from round the wicket, played off the back foot towards point
short of a length once again, played off the back foot towards point
fuller ball just outside off stump, driven off the front foot through cover to bring up the 50 partnership

Mushfiqur tried to lift his bat out of the way to avoid a short of a length ball angling into him from outside off, he was late in doing so and the ball hit the bat and went on the bounce towards Watson's right at first slip
played towards point
short of a length ball played off the body towards the leg side
dabbed off the front foot towards point, he wants the single but there isn't one
Mahmudullah clears his front foot out of the way and slogs across the line and against the turn, he doesn't make good contact at all
Mushfiqur steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives fluently to long-off
played with soft hands in front of point and Mahmudullah takes on the fielder for a quick single
cut off the back foot towards point where Ponting dives to his left and fields
Mushfiqur steps out of his crease, moves towards leg to make room, and lofts the ball over extra cover. His footwork is refreshing after the dreariness earlier in the Bangladesh innings
played off the front foot towards point
short ball and it's rather fast, Mushfiqur bails out of the shot and leaves his bat in the air
a full and straight ball, driven to mid-off, Johnson has over-stepped and the crowd come to life in anticipation of the free-hit. That's a tight call from the umpire.
ah ha, it was the bouncer, Mushfiqur cleared his front foot out of the way and prepared to slog, but he had to duck and avoid it in the end
good length and length on middle stump from round the wicket, defended on the off side
Mushfiqur drives at a fuller ball outside off and gets beaten
short of a length ball angling into the right-hander, Mushfiqur steers towards third man
Mushfiqur steps out and chips the ball in the air but towards wide mid-on for a single
driven off the front foot towards long off
bowled flatter and straighter, played off the pads through square leg
Mahmudullah plays the reverse paddle once again, this time from middle stump, and he gives Brett Lee a chase o prevent the ball from reaching the third man boundary
cut off the back foot towards deep point
defended on the front foot towards the bowler. That's the end of Doherty's spell. Tidy but not memorable.
short ball on leg stump, Mahmudullah plays the ball off his pads towards fine leg
another short ball and Mushfiqur swivels and pulls along the ground to deep square leg
played from the crease through point for one more
good length ball angling into off stump, played with an open face towards point
strays on to the pads and Mushfiqur glances behind square
full ball on off stump, played from the crease towards extra cover
short ball with width outside off stump, cut off the back foot, the placement is excellent and it beats the fielder at short point
played off the back foot towards backward point
driven through cover for another single
Mahmudullah tries to drive but gets a thick outside edge towards third man
good length on off stump, punched towards long off for one more
played off the pads towards midwicket
good length ball angling into the right-hander, cramping the batsman for room. Defended on the off side
again no room to work with and Mushfiqur dabs it towards third man
good length and straight, on off stump, Mahmudullah moves forward and plays towards cover
dabbed off the back foot towards third man
fuller length and straighter line, Mushfiqur drives with a straight bat past the bowler
played with an angled back towards backward point for a risky single, might have been a run out if there was a direct hit at the striker's end
Watson hits a good length outside off, Mahmudullah tries to steers to third man but gets beaten
lbw! A big wicket before the batting Powerplay. Watson bowled straight, wicket to wicket, Mahmudullah tried to play across the line, was beaten, hit on the pad, and was rather plumb.
Watson angles the ball into the left-hander from round the wicket, played off the pads behind square
driven off the front foot towards long off for a single
defended off the back foot on the leg side
defended from the crease towards the bowler
short of a length ball angling into the body, played behind square leg
full ball angling into Shuvo from round the wicket, driven towards point
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
good length on off and middle, the batsman defends again
the bouncer, and well directed, Shuvo lets it go past
that's a classy short ball once again, homing at the batsman's helmet, Shuvo can't do much but duck
pushed towards the off side for a single
Watson strays down leg side and Shuvo gets a bit of bat on it, enough bat to take the ball past a diving Haddin for four to fine leg
full and straight and a wonderful straight drive from Shuvo, didn't try to hit it too hard, just hit it dead straight past the bowler
the slower ball from Watson, defended on the front foot towards the bowler
pushed off the front foot towards cover with soft hands for a single
width offered outside off stump and Mushfiqur cuts the ball hard, placing it fine of the fielder at short third man, best over of the innings by miles
played towards square leg, Mushfiqur is struggling with his running, it's a hot day in Mirpur
a short ball and Mushfiqur swats it through midwicket, that was a slower short ball
Lee bowls a yorker, and Shuvo's attempted drive finishes as a dig back to the bowler
Shuvo moves towards leg to make room but Lee follows and cramps him. Played towards midwicket for one
the slower short ball beats Mushfiqur's attempted heave over midwicket. Mushfiqur looks exhausted
shot! Full and straight, Mushfiqur stands in his crease and gives the ball a powerful thump that beats mid-off and runs to the boundary
deft shot! Shuvo backs away towards leg to make room and then dabs the ball fine past Haddin for four, the length was too short from Johnson
caught at cover! Shuvo backs away to a length delivery and tries to slap it over the infield, he doesn't get enough elevation and Smith takes the catch above his head
a wild slog from Shafiul, aiming for down the ground, gets beaten outside off. Take a single and get off strike!
or that! Shafiul prods at one that slants across him from round the wicket and edges it, the ball falls short of first slip and the bounce beats the fielder and Bangladesh get four to third man
played from the crease towards Ponting to point

Shafiul clears his front foot out of the way and thrashes at the ball. Where he was aiming for, I can't be certain. He ended up slicing it towards Lee who fumbled on the backward point boundary to allow the second. I never thought they'd make it so far but Bangladesh have gone past 200
that's a high full toss, a no-ball for height, and Mushfiqur was taken by surprise and mis-timed the shot on the leg side
a low full toss, attempted yorker, Mushfiqur makes room and drives towards cover
another low full toss outside off, Shafiul plays the ball towards cover point for another single
short ball and Mushfiqur was in no position to play it, he had to duck and avoid it in the end
well done Mushfiqur! He backed away towards leg to create room, Lee followed him with a short ball, Mushfiqur adjusted his shot and chipped it over the keeper for four
it's been a long time coming! Length ball from Lee, Mushfiqur clears his front foot out of the way and slams it over deep midwicket, Mirpur roars as the ball sails into the stands
expensive end from Lee, full of leg stump, Mushfiqur glances the ball off his pads between the keeper and the fielder at short fine leg
Shafiul clears his front foot and biffs a length ball towards wide mid-off to give Mushfiqur the strike
he's on fire is little Mushfiqur! Length ball outside off stump, the batsman lines it up and slaps it in the air and just out of reach of the leaping fielder at cover
a slower ball from Johnson and Mushfiqur gets beaten by the change of pace, he tried to heave that over midwicket

length again from Johnson and Mushfiqur has smashed it over midwicket. He picked it up early and hit it very high over midwicket. That looked to have just cleared the boundary but it's been given four. Will have to check replays.
mis-hit towards midwicket for a single
Shafiul backs away and plays the ball to cover for one

inn2.comm: starts with a wide ball outside off stump, was just inside the tram line I think but the umpire is harsher than I am
short, wide and smashed. Too much room from Shafiul and poor length, Watson cuts with power through point
good length and closer to off stump, Watson moves forward and shoulders arms
length ball outside off, Watson strides forward and plays a muscular drive past the short cover fielder and wide of the man at mid-off
too full and straight, Watson barely moves before bringing his bat down straight and driving the ball between the bowler and mid-on, Shafiul copping a hammering
driven off the front foot into the ground and towards the bowler
short and wide outside off again, Watson cuts into the ground and over backward point towards third man
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Watson goes back and plays towards the bowler
good length and very straight, driven back to the bowler once again
Watson closes the face to play on the leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad, Razzak appeals but that was missing leg
that's too short and what a shot that is! Watson clears his front foot out of the way and pulls the ball hard and straight past the bowler. All the finesse of a wrecking ball but it got the job done.
played towards deep midwicket for a single
the arm ball into the right-hander, Watson defends on the off side
Watson gets down on one knee to sweep and gets an inside edge behind square when he was aiming for midwicket
played behind point for two more
Watson uses his long reach to lunge forward and heave the ball over deep midwicket, immense power, Australia are racing away and Haddin hasn't faced a ball!
driven off the pads to deep midwicket, and Haddin has the strike
Haddin gets going smoothly with a clip off his pads through midwicket
Haddin misses the glance off the pads
defended on the front foot towards the leg side
Haddin moves forward and defends on the off
that's a bit too short and Haddin mis-times the back-foot cut towards cover point
tossed up on off and middle, Haddin defends on the front foot
Haddin is hogging the strike now, takes a single after five dots by playing the ball off his pads behind square
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Haddin gets behind the line of a quick one and blocks on the leg side
played off the front foot towards midwicket
Haddin uses his feet to step out, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it through the line, over the fielder at mid-on
played back to the bowler
Haddin steps out again, realises he isn't to the pitch of the ball and pads it away
that's fired down leg side and Watson misses the glance. Huge appeal for caught behind but the umpire is unmoved. No wide called so must have been pad.
and Watson continues bullying the bowlers, waiting for the ball to angle into him before swinging with power through midwicket
defended back to the bowler
played off the back foot towards midwicket
What's Watson had for lunch? He clears his front foot out of the way to open his shoulders and create hitting space. And hit it he does, slamming the ball over deep midwicket with a slog sweep
bowled flat on middle stump, played off the back foot through midwicket, Watson keeps strike now
that's short and Watson is hitting better balls than those. He hits this one as well, pulling it flat off the back foot over the deep square leg boundary
fired in quick outside off, Watson aimed for another hit but then cut the ball into the ground towards slip
ok this is painful to watch now, Watson gets to fifty by heaving a short ball off the back foot over long-on, cleared it comfortably. Bangladesh had got to 50 in the 18th over.
Watson misses the slog sweep, Bangladesh sigh in relief
defended on the off side
ah ha, Watson cleverly keeps strike by pushing the last ball towards wide mid-on
full ball on middle stump, Watson is magnanimous and takes a single by driving to long-on
Haddin uses the leg-stump line to glance the ball past short fine leg for two more
Haddin tries to hit over the top on the leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad
loud appeal for lbw after Haddin got squared up and beaten, he was hit on the pad. Looked close but perhaps missing leg.
defended on the leg side
Haddin moves back, gets behind the line, and defends
Watson strides forward, but instead of unleashing hell on the bowlers in the direction of midwicket, he defends.
played through the leg side for a single

caught at midwicket. It's Robin, though, not Batman. Haddin charges and tries to hit over the leg side, he gets beaten in the flight and makes contact with the inner part of the bat. The bat turned on impact as well. The ball flies in the air at Mahmudullah, who takes a simple catch
Ponting strides forward, gets behind the line and defends
Ponting lunges and defends with bat close to pad
Ponting goes back and punches off the back foot but Shakib moves to his right and stops the ball
Watson tries to play the leg glance but makes poor contact
Watson lunges forward and defends with a straight bat
driven hard into the ground and towards the bowler
the quicker ball on middle stump, Watson is waiting for the opportunity to hit but doesn't get it, he defends on the off side
well he's got it this time, short ball and that is simply too easy for Watson who once again shows off his pulling skills by heaving a long hop into the first tier at midwicket
tries to play down to fine leg but misses and gets hit on the pad
Ponting moves forward and defends on the off side
Ponting lunges, like he usually does, and defends
played towards point off the front foot
tossed up slowly on off stump, defended on the off side
that's wide down leg side and Ponting should have done more with it than paddle to short fine leg. Watson would have hit it to Chittagong.
defended on the off side
good length at skiddy pace around off stump, Watson defends on the front foot
short and wide outside off stump, Watson moves forward and lays into it, swinging his bat heavily to cut the ball through point
Watson drives the ball hard into the ground towards cover, he bats with such industrial power
short and wide outside off stump, Watson slashes and goes hard at the ball, edging it in the air towards the third man boundary
length ball outside off stump, the broad bat of Watson comes crashing down on the ball and sends it through cover point
Ponting gets off the mark by pushing off the front foot towards cover. He's made a Kayes-esque start.
well that is a poor start to Ponting, a short ball down leg side, Ponting hit one of those to short fine leg earlier, this time he pulls it to the long leg boundary
tossed up on middle and leg, flicked behind square for a single
punched off the back foot towards long on for a single
Ponting moves forward, and then goes back to work the ball off his pads through square
tossed up on middle stump, Watson makes room and drives along the ground to long-on
Ponting steps out and drives towards mid-on
good length and straight, punched off the front foot towards mid-off
that's a little short and Watson pulls, hitting the ball with the toe of the bat. Such is his power though that the ball races to the midwicket boundary
good length outside off, Watson drives off the front foot to cover, smack out of the middle that was
fuller length outside off, driven off the front foot towards mid-off
he can be delicate too! A high full toss on leg stump, and instead of smashing it to smithereens, Watson merely helps it around the corner, wide of the fielder at short fine leg
a full ball nearly in the blockhole, dug out past the bowler for a single
Ponting moves forward and plays a fluent drive towards mid-on
too far down leg side, Watson gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball in the air and down to the vacant long-leg boundary
this is brutal, Watson gets down low once again, and swings the hammer of Thor to bash to ball over deep square leg with the slog sweep, unbelievable striking
played back to the bowler
pushed off the front foot towards mid-on
Ponting tries to pull a slower ball and gets into a tangle of sorts, he doesn't make contact
short ball outside off but Ponting hits it off the back foot straight to the man at cover. What would Watson have done with that, I wonder?
punched towards long-on off the back foot
played back to the bowler off the front foot
Ponting's timing his drives well but hitting it to fielders, this one goes off the front foot towards cover
terrific shot, that was nearly a yorker but Ponting brought his bat down in time and punched the ball past the bowler. Less power, more timing.
played from the crease towards point
short and wide outside off, cut off the front foot to deep point to bring up the 50 partnership
defended on the front foot
pushed off the front foot back to the bowler, he's biding his time here
he got into position to hit over midwicket but had to defend off the back foot because the ball was flat and fast
played off the pads through midwicket for a single
Ponting moves down leg and then tries to sweep, trying to beat short fine leg, but doesn't
defended on the front foot towards the off
6 off two now, this one was a yorker on off stump, Watson dug it out on the off side for a single
Ponting moves forward and times the drive well, but straight to the bowler
can't find gaps in the field, go over them! Ponting gets on to the front foot and swings his bat hard, hitting through the line of the ball and sending it over the wide long-on boundary
played to midwicket for a single
a full ball with some swing into the right-hander, Watson flicks through square leg. He needs five off 1 ball to break Hayden's record. Five off 2 to equal it.
driven on the leg side for a single
Ponting drives to long-on for a single
ah, Watson! Defends the ball back to the bowler to give up the chance of breaking Hayden's fastest hundred by an Australian
driven off the back foot through cover
Ponting moves back and punches the ball towards long on
Watson moves back, gets cramped for room, but still manages to punch the ball through wide mid-on
Ponting steps out and moves towards leg to make room to hit inside out towards off, he gets a thick outside edge that flies through the gap between backward point and short third man
Watson tries to drive but gets an inside edge behind square, he comes back for the second and moves on to 99
take a bow Shane Watson! He brings up ODI century No. 6 with a fluent drive of the front foot through extra cover, threading the gap between cover and mid-off. Terrific shot.

dropped. Watson goes big, lofting the ball high in the air towards long-on where Razzak runs back and tries to take the catch, he gets both hands to it but can't hold on, the ball pops out of his hands and falls just inside the boundary before going over. Tough chance, because Razzak was looking over his shoulder while he was running towards the boundary
full toss on middle and leg, Watson flicks the ball through midwicket
Ponting drives a full ball towards long-on
the slower ball and Watson works it through midwicket
Watson aims for the coruscating swing over midwicket but gets a thick edge that flies over the man at first slip for four
hit in the air but falls well short of the man at long-on
Ponting nudges the ball towards long-on for a single

dropped! Again! Watson finally mis-times a slog sweep high in the air towards deep midwicket, Raqibal Hasan runs to his right towards the ball, gets to it while he's on the move and then drops it. Not an easy chance but they must be taken if you want to compete against Australia.
played towards midwicket
Ponting moves forward and then sweeps the ball behind square
driven to long on for a single
so we've seen this before. Watson down on one knee, waiting for the ball angling into him from the left-armer, swinging the bat with tremendous power and slamming the ball over deep midwicket
Bangladesh are being battered and bullied, Watson gets down and then hammers it over the long-on boundary this time, he clears it by miles

this is carnage, Bangladesh are defenceless, rubbish bowling though. Full toss on leg stump and Watson swings it over the deep backward square leg boundary. He's hit the most sixes by an Australian in an innings.
this has gone too, Watson picks it up from outside off and heaves the ball over wide long-on, that went into the first tier
Watson hammers the ball hard and straight but along the ground, giving the fielder at long off some work to do
Ponting strides forward and defends on the off side, the whole world outside Bangladesh wants him to take a single
played to long-on for a single
Watson heaves again, this time along the ground to deep midwicket
Ponting moves back and plays the ball on the leg side
driven to long-on for a single
Gulp. Watson sees a short ball, and pulls again, giving it plenty of air time as it makes the journey from pitch to stand beyond wide long-on
driven off the front foot through cover
Watson aims for down the ground and unbelievably it doesn't come off. He slices it in the air over point to bring up his 150
Watson plonks that heavy foot forward and drills the ball down the ground to long off
driven fluently off the front foot through cover, Ponting letting Watson do all the hard work!
a yorker, and for once Watson has no option but to defend
a low full toss and Watson drives to long-off to keep strike
Watson equals the world record for most sixes in an innings by heaving the ball over long-on. That's his 12th and he draws level with Xavier Marshall.
and he's broken it. His 13th six. Again heaved over wide long-on. He takes the record for most sixes in an innings from Xavier Marshall. Bangladesh want this over with now
Watson pulls and misses this time. Getting beaten outside off stump
it's a disappointing four. Watson pulls with power into the gap between two people on the midwicket boundary
Watson aims for another leg-side boundary and misses

yawn. Watson gets down on one knee, swings his bat with the power of a superhuman, and hits his 14th six, over midwicket again, with a slog sweep. This is getting stale now. How about a reverse-sweep for six?
Ponting drives straight down the ground for a single
full ball outside off, Watson chops own on it and plays towards point
full toss on middle and leg stump, Watson fails to hit his 15th, managing to swing it through square leg for a measly four.
well he's got his 15th!! This time with a cool swing through the line, lofting the ball straight over the fielder on the long-on boundary
mis-hit through midwicket for a single
Ponting has his moment in Watson's sun, pulling the ball through backward square to score the winning runs. Bangladesh's torment is over.
